The 'Ulvophyceae' or 'Ulvophytes' are class of green algae, distinguished mainly on the basis of ultrastructural morphology. The sea
lettuce, Ulva, belongs here. Other well-known members include [[Ulothrix]] and
[[Acetabularia]]. The Ulvophytes are diverse in their morphology and their
habitat. Most are seaweeds such as those listed above. Others, such as
[[Cladophora]], [[Rhizoclonium]] and [[Pithophora]] live in fresh water and in
some areas are considered weeds.
